Gun violence is a public health crisis. We need to work together with the medical community to support research and data-informed approaches to curbing gun violence: just like we would for any other disease #Building4Us

Pain management is a complex, multifaceted skill that needs to be honed and refined just like any other aspect of a physician’s medical education. Proud to be an original sponsor of this bipartisan effort!

Proud to cosponsor the ANTIQUITIES Act, legislation that protects national monuments across our nation. Public lands are at the heart of our American identity, and we have a responsibility to protect our Desert’s natural beauty for generations to come!

Big and long overdue news for Blue Water Navy veterans! I have fought the VA and supported legislation to provide Blue Navy Veterans the benefits they have earned. I urge the VA and Trump Admin to let this ruling stand. Do not appeal to the Supreme Court! https://www.militarytimes.com/news/pentagon-congress/2019/01/29/court-rules-va-must-pay-disability-benefits-to-blue-water-vietnam-veterans/ …

Honored to earn a perfect score on @EQCA’s 2018 legislative scorecard! Looking forward to another year of advocating for the civil rights of LGBTQ+ individuals in our communities and across our nation.

Pay discrimination has no place in our nation, and we must build on progress made by the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act passed into law ten years ago. Together, we can build a more fair and equitable society. https://nwlc.org/resources/lilly-ledbetter-fair-pay-act/ …
I have cosponsored H.R. 674, the Gun Violence Prevention Research Act, which will start to address this by authorizing $50 million for the CDC to research gun violence prevention. #NeverAgain

Gun violence claimed more than 13,000 lives in 2018, but our nation has failed to support adequate public health research that could identify the causes and characteristics of gun violence so we can enact policies that save lives – all because of politics and campaign promises.

On Friday, I joined FIND Food Bank to hear from federal employees who weren’t paid during the government shutdown and provide them with free meals. Many of these families will continue to feel the shutdown's effects in the weeks ahead.
 https://www.kesq.com/news/find-food-bank-hosting-food-resource-event-to-help-federal-workers/988108560 …
Bottom line, this shutdown should never have happened, and politicians should never intentionally harm the American people with a shutdown as leverage for political gain.

The shutdown will soon be over but the damage from this reckless shutdown will be felt for months and years to come. Families have lost thousands from their retirement, incurred late payment fees, face higher interest rate penalties, and small businesses may never fully recover.

Excited to see some familiar faces tomorrow at the Pass Area Veterans Expo! This is a great chance for veterans to learn about the services and benefits available to them. The event will be from 10 am to 1 pm at the Beaumont Civic Center, 550 E. We must heed the warnings of military leaders like Former Secretary of Defense General Mattis to support NATO and our allies. Today, we keep Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s legacy alive by standing up to hatred, white supremacy, and racism. In doing so, we embrace the values Dr. King lived: justice, equality, and the courage to do what is right.

Last week, I cosponsored the Seniors have Eyes, Ears, and Teeth Act, legislation that would expand Medicare coverage to include eyeglasses, hearing aids, and dental care. Our seniors deserve comprehensive health care!

If you are a federal employee in California who is not being paid during the shutdown, you are eligible for unemployment insurance. If you have any questions about this process, don’t hesitate to contact my office at 760-424-8888. We are here to serve you! https://www.latimes.com/politics/la-pol-ca-gavin-newsom-california-tsa-workers-shutdown-20190117-story.html?fbclid=IwAR1QFACJLQJn_HySDXoraAB1ujRT4vTRkyj2TeU8Gq3XFXstja3nZ9kDGo0 …

We have a responsibility to provide our veterans with high-quality health care. I will evaluate the Administration’s proposals to reform the VA based on a simple criteria: any plan to reform the VA should be veteran-centered. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/12/us/politics/veterans-administration-health-care-privatization.html?fbclid=IwAR3tWAq_GY97oltbbKBpRPs4tBZwCqbk3Oxc_sQcCo0-kfAfz0Mm3Dy3j20 …

I just voted for legislation that would provide desperately needed disaster assistance to California communities affected by the wildfires across our state. The government shutdown is no excuse to neglect our duty to serve first responders and the victims of natural disasters.

Since I was a kid, my dream was to become a doctor to improve the health and lives of the people across our region and our nation. Now as your Representative, I am honored to bring this mission to the Health Subcommittee of the Energy and Commerce Committee.

Congratulations to the Palm Springs International Film Festival on their 30th anniversary! The film festival attracts producers, actors, actresses, and thousands of film enthusiasts to our beautiful valley. Learn more about the festival here:  https://www.psfilmfest.org/2019-ps-film-festival/about …

We have made so much progress in raising awareness about the dangers of exposure to burn pits. In 2019, I will continue fighting for our veterans who have developed rare cancers and pulmonary conditions from their exposure to toxic burn pits. https://www.militarytimes.com/news/pentagon-congress/2019/01/02/new-in-2019-advocates-hope-to-reignite-debate-over-long-term-effects-of-burn-pits/ …

This week, I was proud to support the Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness and Advancing Innovation Act. I’ve travelled to humanitarian crises around the world: I know how important it is to have the appropriate medical resources before a disaster occurs.

Today, hundreds of thousands of federal workers – including thousands in our district – will miss their first paycheck. We must stand up for federal employees, including TSA Agents and Coast Guard servicemembers. It’s time to put people over partisanship.

The expansion of the Desert Healthcare District will mean millions of dollars to fund health care for underserved communities in the East Valley. Immensely proud of everyone who helped us reach this milestone!
 https://bit.ly/2CecpcY

Congratulations Governor Newsom on being sworn in as California’s 40th governor.
